title: M1 closed in both directions near Barnsley after pedestrian dies in collision with Mercedes
text:
Police closed the M1 motorway in both directions after a pedestrian was killed in a collision with a car in South Yorkshire.

Emergency services were called to scene of the collision on the northbound carriageway between junctions 35A and 36 south of Barnsley at at 11:52pm on Friday.

A 25 year-old man was pronounced dead at the scene. South Yorkshire Police said the car involved in the collision was reported to be a black Mercedes CLA and appealed for witnesses and information.

The M1 was shut in both directions between Chapeltown and Tankersley to allow officers to investigate the incident.

Highways England said they were hoping to reopen the motorway by 5pm on Saturday, more than 17 hours after the fatal crash.

Motorists – including football fans travelling to and from the match between Leeds United and Birmingham City – were advised to avoid the area.

“The road is closed in both directions due to a police incident,” Highways England said in a statement. “The earliest estimation for this to be reopened is 5pm. Please try to avoid this route where possible and use alternative routes.”

Diversions were set up to take traffic via the A616 and A61, causing severe delays. Parts of the A1 and M18 were also affected.

And while Highways England claimed that delays were between 15 and 30 minutes, one motorist claimed they it took them two hours to negotiate the route.

South Yorkshire Police said in a statement: “Officers investigating a collision on the M1 last night, Friday 18 October are appealing for witnesses and information to help with their enquires.

“Emergency services were called at 11.52pm following reports that a black Mercedes CLA had been involved in a collision with a pedestrian in the third lane of the carriageway between junction 35A and 36 Northbound.

“The pedestrian, a 25 year-old man was pronounced dead at the scene. His family are being supported by specially trained officers.

“Officers would like to speak to anyone who witnessed the collision or may have been in the area at the time.”
description: Police closed the M1 motorway in both directions after a pedestrian was killed in a collision with a car in South Yorkshire. Emergency services were called to scene of the collision on the northbound carriageway between junctions 35A and 36 south of Barnsley at at 11:52pm on Friday.
